alert.note: Alert for Hickman (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 4:32PM CST until February 22 at 11:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Piney River Near Vernon affecting Hickman County. For the Piney River...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Piney River Near Vernon. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Water begins to overflow the natural banks and inundates low lying areas along the river from Interstate 40 to near Pinewood, Nunnelly, and down to the Duck River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 10.4 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river will continue rising through early this evening before falling. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 945 PM CST.
